author: Brian P. Kelly
title: ‘2001: A Space Odyssey’ at 50: A Quiet Film Still Makes a Big Bang
text:
In 1968, America had its eyes turned to the stars, but its extraterrestrial gaze had as much to do with earthbound worries as excitement about interplanetary exploration. Fears about the Bomb had led to the signing of the Outer Space Treaty the previous year, in which the U.S. and U.S.S.R. agreed not to put weapons of mass destruction into orbit. Looking to the future, President John F. Kennedy’s goal, set earlier in the decade, of landing a man on the moon seemed within reach.
It was into this age of concern about mutually...
